conclusion: Analyze the motion of the electron in the electric field to determine its kinetic energy at point C.
Determine the vertical component of the velocity at point C using the tangent of the angle.
Calculate the kinetic energy at point C using K = 1/2 m v^2.
Find the magnitude of the velocity v using the Pythagorean theorem: v = √(v_0^2 + v_y^2).
Substitute v_y and v_0 to find v = 8 * 10^6 / √3 m/s.
Calculate the kinetic energy K = 9.7 * 10^-17 J.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is 9.7 * 10^-17 J.
